name: Lisa Lindahl, Hinda Miller, Polly Palmer Smith
quote: This was made by women for women.
summary: Inventors of the sports bra (Jogbra), revolutionizing athletic wear for women.
shortDescription: Lisa Lindahl, Hinda Miller, and Polly Palmer Smith invented the sports bra, making exercise more comfortable for women and helping to open doors for women in sports.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in the 1970s, these three women were active in sports and fitness but found that existing athletic wear didn't meet women's needs. They were inspired to create better solutions for women athletes.
detailed_description.stem_journey: The trio combined their experiences in sports, business, and design to create the first sports bra. They used their understanding of women's needs to develop a product that would revolutionize athletic wear.
detailed_description.challenges: As women inventors in the 1970s, they faced skepticism about their product and had to overcome gender barriers in the male-dominated sports industry. They also had to educate the market about the need for their invention.
detailed_description.achievements: They invented the Jogbra, the first sports bra designed specifically for women athletes. Their invention revolutionized athletic wear and helped open doors for women in sports and fitness.
detailed_description.legacy: Their work has enabled millions of women to participate comfortably in sports and fitness activities, and their success paved the way for women entrepreneurs in the athletic wear industry.
